question: My son, 18, has just been diagnosed with having Mild Diabetes, with A1C of 6.3, and daily glucose readings 70s through 80s.  The doc has prescribed Metformin.  My son is not overweight, and has always been very health-conscious, so we are stumped by this finding.Is there anything else that can mimic diabetes?  We are trying to figure if it would be possible for him to get on a rigorous exercise program, along with meticulous dietary regimen, and if that will make a difference.  It is just so weird because he does not manifest the typical signs and symptoms of diabetes, except for the findings of these tests.My husband does have diabetes type 2 which started when he was in in forties.  There is no one in the history of the family who has had diabetes at such a young age.  Any thoughts?
title: Diabetes at 18
